Increased empathy: As humans would be more aware of the feelings and perspectives of animals, empathy and compassion towards them would increase, leading to a more caring and inclusive society.
Changes in animal welfare: With animals able to express their needs, their living conditions would likely improve, leading to better overall welfare for the animals.
New forms of entertainment: Talkative animals would provide a new source of entertainment, such as animal stand-up comedy, animal storytelling, and even animal game shows.

New forms of education: Educational content would expand to include lessons on animal behavior, communication, and care. This would lead to a better understanding of the natural world and promote environmental conservation.
Changes in animal law and policy: Laws and policies would likely evolve to prioritize animal welfare, given their newfound ability to communicate their needs.
